content.question:
“Aeole, namque tibi divum pater atque hominum

et mulcere dedit fluctus et tollere vento,

gens inimica mihi Tyrrhenum navigat aequor,

Ilium in Italiam portans victosque Penates:

5 incute vim ventis submersasque obrue puppes,

aut age diversos et disiice corpora ponto.”

Aeneid 1.65-70

Answer the following questions in English unless the question specifically asks you to write out Latin words. Number your answer to each question.

1. (A) Translate in context tibi dedit (lines 1-2) and (B) identify the case of tibi.

2. What Latin noun is the direct object of mulcere (line 2) ?

3. How does the speaker describe the gens (line 3) that is sailing the Tyrrhenian Sea?

4. Write out all of line 3 (gens . . . aequor) and mark the scansion.

5. What are Penates (line 4) ?

6. Name one and only one of the tasks Aeolus is asked to perform in lines 5-6 (incute . . . ponto).

unit.text: 4: Teacher's Choice - Latin Poetry and Vergil's Aeneid, Excerpts from Books 1 and 2

skill.text: 1.A: Identify the meaning of Latin words and phrases.
